column4: Ich habe es mir anders überlegt ...

column2: You are already married, remember? To [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName]?
column3: Vous êtes déjà marié, vous vous souvenez ? [From.Spouse.Get_au_TitledFirstName] ?
column4: Ihr seid bereits verheiratet, erinnert Ihr Euch? Mit [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName]?

column2:
This mod brings a little sillyness and makes you very powerful.

As a result of enabling, your existing counsil members and commanders will be fired, so you can start fresh.

Are you up to the challenge of conquering the world?
Can we introduce you to someone special?
That belly dancer looks cute in her revealing robes!
That warrior looks cute in her shining armour!
That gentleman looks so handsome in his suit!
That guy with the pointy ears seems a good fit!
That guy seems to know what he's doing!
That girl in the shining armour seems very capable!
My wife is perfect for the job!
This option is available due to [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] §RMartial§! skill
That guy seems to be going places!
That handsome gentleman might shake things up!
That cute belly dancer might stir things up!
This option is available due to [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] §YIntrigue§! skill
That guy with the curly hair seems to be the ideal hippy!
That girl in the shining armour seems very capable!
My wife is perfect for the job!
This option is available due to [Root.Spouse.GetHerHis] §RMartial§! skill
Sadly, I've already assigned my wife as marshal...
Sadly, there are no available candidates
That guy isn't going to revolt, right? ... Right?
That guy looks very familiar! Could it be...?
What kind of animal do you like?
Okay, okay. No need to get snarky!\nMaybe something else?
Actually, I'm more into picking flowers...
Are you a lumberjack by any chance?
Wauw! Sounds like someone needs a chill pill!\nYou know what's going to happen next, right?
Sure, if you're into that!\nHow about some upgrades?
You are pregnant, and you already have [local_child_count.GetValue] children!
Your wife [From.GetFirstName] is pregnant, and you already have [local_child_count.GetValue] children!
I must put a stop to this!
